relationships.evidence_text: Welcome to the Y-Energ Community Podcast. I'm your host, Aaron William Perry.
we're visiting with Ichao Ruiz from the Rodale Institute.

the Rodale Institute, a nonprofit research and education organization.
has been widely recognized as the global leader of regenerative agriculture.
His research interest is focused on improving Soil Health and Environmental Sustainability through regenerative practices.
Ichao holds a bachelor of science and biology from Nanka University.

relationships.evidence_text: Let me remind our audience. This is the Why on Earth Community podcast. I'm your host, Aaron William Perry.
today we're visiting with Dr. Yee Chow Rui from the Rodale Institute.
...we're visiting with Dr. Yee Chow Rui from the Rodale Institute.
I was born in China. I grew up in Eastern China.
I have lived in Australia different parts in China Australia and different parts in the United States.
I have lived in Australia different parts in China Australia and different parts in the United States.
I've been lucky to have the support from my wife to be doing that.
I witnessed the environmental degradation of my hometown.
I could still remember the smell of the chemical that my dad used to spray in our rice paddy field.
those things really made me think and later became very interested in all these environmental problems.
I started my career in soil science and sustainability research.
in 80s and 90s in China the economy started to boom.
the green manure cover crops were abandoned in China because the chemicals became so dominant.
What Confucius say on how ancestors were able to maintain so a fertility and long term productivity organically.

the nature and the mother earth and be more humble and careful our soil and mother earth.
